problems.title: Fruit Into Baskets
problems.description:
You are visiting a farm that has a single row of fruit trees arranged from left to right. The trees are represented by an integer array fruits where fruits[i] is the type of fruit the i-th tree produces.
You want to collect as much fruit as possible. However, the owner has some strict rules that you must follow:

You only have two baskets, and each basket can only hold a single type of fruit. There is no limit on the amount of fruit each basket can hold.
You can start at any tree, but you must pick exactly one fruit from every tree you visit as you move to the right. The visited trees must form a single continuous segment.

Given the integer array fruits, return the maximum number of fruits you can pick.

Input Format:
First line: single integer n.
Second line: n space-separated integers representing fruit types.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum number of fruits you can pick.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
6
1 2 1 2 3 3

Sample Output
5

Explanation:
We can pick from trees 1 to 5: [1,2,1,2,3] which contains 2 types of fruits.
hintsList: Use sliding window with a map to track frequency of fruit types in current window.
Maintain at most 2 distinct fruit types in the window, expand right, shrink from left when more than 2 types.
